headline: Warnock to Georgians in debut 2022 ad: I see you, I hear you, I am you.
author: Greg Bluestein
sentences: Georgia voters are on edge about rising inflation rates and economic struggles, according to an Atlanta Journal-Constitution poll that also shows Warnock in a tight race against Republican football standout Herschel Walker in a hypothetical matchup.

Warnock, pastor of Atlantas Ebenezer Baptist Church, opens the ad acknowledging that people are hurting, people are tired, people have seen what theyve worked their entire lives to build turned upside down at a moments notice.

Republican frontrunner Herschel Walker told donors in a memo Monday that the roughly $725,000 that Warnock has put behindthe ad is proof that our Democrat opponent is very concerned about his reelection chances.
The minute-long spot comes as polls show a challenging re-election climate for the Democrat, one of the most vulnerable Senate incumbents on the ballot in November.
Democratic U.S. Sen. Raphael Warnocks first TV ad aims to connect with apprehensive Georgia voters with a concise message: I see you, I hear you, I am you.
I understand the work I was sent to the Senate to do, Warnock said in the ad debuting Tuesday, and thats what I intend to keep doing for Georgia.
Theyre wondering when things will get back to normal and at the same time not knowing what normal even means anymore, he said.
Theyre wondering when things will get back to normal and at the same time not knowing what normal even means anymore.
People have seen what theyve worked their entire lives to build turned upside down at a moments notice.
I understand the work I was sent to the Senate to do and thats what I intend to keep doing for Georgia.
It means understanding the challenges you face, and then doing my best to make a difference.
It means understanding the challenges you face, and then doing my best to make a difference.
Warnock dipped into his $23 million warchest to finance the ad, which will air statewide.
Thats why Im cracking down on the corporations who are raising prices out of control.
What I want the people of Georgia to know is that I see you, I hear you, I am you.
Thats why I know we must make health care more affordable.
Thats why Ive worked so hard to protect and create jobs.
At my heart I am, and will always be, a pastor.
At my heart I am, and will always be, a pastor.

The transcript:
[WARNOCK]: People are hurting.
Im Raphael Warnock and I approve this message.
That means going to work for my congregation.
That means going to work for my congregation.
Every day I carry your concerns with me.
People are tired.
